node.title: UPS Will Pay Employees $1M After Judge Finds They Illegally Diverted Salaries to Charities
node.description: A union president encouraged UPS employees to accept the settlement and "make the company pay for what they did wrong."

node.title: Midwest Saw Record-Breaking Twisters and Deadliest December Day in Tornado History
node.description: At least 64 people have died from the storms in Kentucky alone, and officials believe the total death toll could exceed 100.

node.title: South Africa's President tests positive for COVID-19
node.description: After testing positive for COVID-19 and a surge in Omicron cases, South Africa's president urges people in South Africa to get vaccinated.

node.title: Victoria records 1,189 new COVID-19 cases and six deaths
node.description: There are now 11,051 active cases of the virus in Victoria, and 605 people have died during the current outbreak.

node.title: Masayuki Uemura, 78, Dies; Designed the First Nintendo Console
node.description: He developed the Nintendo Entertainment System in the 1980s, which laid the foundation for today’s enormous video game console market and franchises like Super Mario Brothers.

node.title: Russia Blocks U.N. Move to Treat Climate as Security Threat
node.description: The Russian veto of a widely supported Security Council resolution pointed to the difficulty of achieving a unified response to global warming.

node.title: '90 Day Fiancé' Fans 'Can't Wait' for Loren and Alexei's Spinoff, React to Viral Trailer
node.description: "Ohhhhhh yesssss! TLC finally learned how much we love Loren and Alexei!" said one fan on Instragram.

node.title: Rent or live in an apartment? Here's how you can reap the benefits of solar
node.description: One-third of households are locked out of installing solar panels on their rooftop. Is buying a "plot" in a community "solar garden" a way to access cheaper renewable energy and lower your power bills?

node.title: Ministry of Education records spike in home-schooling applications
node.description: Figures show there were more than 100 applications a month before the pandemic and fewer than 200 a month for most of last year and this year. But in October there were about 500 applications and in…

node.title: A Joyful Christmas Morning Starts With Something Sweet
node.description: Big brunch dishes and holiday-spiced small treats capture the spirit of sharing and can be prepared ahead for effortless snacks.

node.title: Kamala Harris Highlights $5B Plan for Vehicle Charging Stations Across U.S.
node.description: Harris said the plan is designed to increase accessibility to electric vehicles, and the charging stations required for the vehicles across the country.

node.title: Deputy Prime Minister calls for Julian Assange to kept in Britain or returned home
node.description: Barnaby Joyce says Wikileaks founder Julian Assange should not be extradited to the United States, as he questions why Australia would allow its citizen to be tried there.

node.title: Britain reports world's first publicly confirmed death from Omicron COVID variant
node.description: UK Health Secretary Sajid Javid says the Omicron coronavirus variant now accounts for 44 per cent of infections in London and will be the dominant strain there within 48 hours.

node.title: Rugby players will need vaccination passes for club games
node.description: Club and college rugby players will need a Covid vaccination certificate to play in competitions from next year.

node.title: Aucklanders looking forward to orange traffic light setting but businesses surprised by delay
node.description: People planning New Year' Eve celebrations in Auckland are hailing the city's next step towards freedom, just in time to bid goodbye and good riddance to 2021. Audio

node.title: Derek Chauvin expected to plead guilty in federal civil rights case
node.description: The change of plea hearing is scheduled for Wednesday in Saint Paul, Minnesota.

node.title: This Delicious Graphic Novel Gets to the Heart of Desserts
node.description: With a food sprite as its guide, “Yummy” by Victoria Grace Elliott tells the histories behind some of the world’s best treats.

node.title: Francis Mallmann Shares the Secrets of Fire Online
node.description: YesChef has added a six-hour cooking course, with more than 40 recipes, from the Argentine grilling master.

node.title: Seasoned Cheddars That Turn Heads
node.description: Beehive Cheese from Utah cleaned up at the 2021 World Cheese Awards with subtly seasoned Cheddars.

node.title: Make a Spicy Gift This Holiday Season
node.description: The Mala Market’s kit for chile crisp makes enough of the fiery condiment to give your friends and family.

node.title: 19-Year-Old Allegedly Recruited Cellmate to Torture, Kill 14 People Connected to His Case
node.description: Dongwook Ko was originally charged with beating and attacking a 13-year-old while they both attended a summer violin camp.

node.title: Philadelphia to Require Proof of Vaccine or Negative COVID Test at Public Indoor Spaces
node.description: Philadelphia is not the first major U.S. city to impose such a measure in the hopes of curtailing infection rates nearly two years into the pandemic.

node.title: 'It makes me sick to drive across it': Outback creek renamed
node.description: An outback council will work with the state government to change the 'racist' name of a creek, but Indigenous elders say there are dozens more just like it across the state.

node.title: USA Gymnastics to pay Larry Nassar abuse survivors $380m
node.description: Survivors of former USA Gymnastics doctor Larry Nassar have been awarded $380 million in damages after a five-year legal battle with the governing body and the US Olympic and Paralympic Committee.

node.title: 'On again': How the $1.9b deal to buy a Pacific telco, and stop China getting it, sat in the balance
node.description: A $1.9 billion deal for taxpayers to fund Telstra to buy a key Pacific telecommunications company – to stop China getting it – may have been close to falling through, FOI documents reveal.

node.title: Kentucky tornadoes: Death toll likely to pass 100, governor says
node.description: Rescue workers are scouring debris for survivors while teams distribute water and generators to residents.

node.title: Northland Chamber boss sees red over continued restrictions
node.description: Northland Chamber of Commerce chief executive Steve Smith - who is "not a huge fan of vaccination" and is opposed to checkpoints - says the government announcement today is "a bitter pill to swallow". Audio

node.title: Northland big cat sanctuary to reopen after fatal tragedy
node.description: A Northland big cat sanctuary closed to the public for nearly eight years will roar back into life tomorrow. Audio

node.title: Recall for ham and pepperoni balloons to 2.3 million pounds
node.description: Perdue Premium Meat Co. unit initially said 232,000 pounds sold nationwide could be contaminated with listeria.

node.title: U.S. woman to face U.K. court over teenager's death
node.description: Sacoolas is accused of killing 19-year-old Harry Dunn in a collision outside an air base in eastern England used by U.S. forces in 2019.
